des:
ComfortClick bOS Smart Home skill enables you to control the devices, connected with bOS.

What is bOS?
bOS stands for building Operating System and it is a product of company ComfortClick. It enables you to control the devices in your smart home from a single app. bOS supports different systems and devices such as: 
- KNX
- Z-Wave
- Modbus
- BACnet
- HTTP 
- DSC Alarm
- Paradox alarm
- Satel Alarm
- Philips Hue lamps
- Samsung TV
- LG TVs
- IP Cameras
- Sonos speakers
- IRTrans devices
- Global Caché devices

To see a full list of supported systems and devices, please visit: www.comfortclick.com/SmartBuilding/Systems. For general information about bOS visit: www.comfortclick.com/BOS/About

Requirements
It is required for a user to have a registered account on our web page www.comfortclick.com and installed bOS server. bOS server can be downloaded and installed for free here: www.comfortclick.com/BOS/Software/BOSServer
If this is your first time working with ComfortClick bOS, please take a look at: www.comfortclick.com/BOS/TryBOS
Once your bOS server is running, follow this guide on how to make it work with Alexa: www.comfortclick.com/Alexa
